thread.title: Family raises reward for info on missing pastor
thread.title_full: Family raises reward for info on missing pastor

author: AKIL YUNUS and ASHLEY TANG
title: Family raises reward for info on missing pastor
text:
by akil yunus and ashley tang 
PETALING JAYA: It has been a week since the mysterious abduction of pastor Raymond Koh Keng Joo ( pic ) without any word from his abductors. His distraught family has now raised the reward for information on his whereabouts to RM100,000. 
The reward has increased ten-fold just two days after an initial offering of RM10,000, in a desperate plea to secure the safe release of Koh, who was abducted from his car in broad daylight last Monday. 
“Our family is grateful and touched that concerned well-wishers have stepped up to increase the reward money,” said Koh’s wife, Susanna Liew, 61. 
“We hope this will help in efforts to find my husband and see his safe and sound return to us,” she added. 
The pastor’s son, Jonathan, said anyone who could provide any kind of information on his father’s abduction would be eligible for the reward. 
“A panel will decide how the full reward will be divided according to the accuracy and usefulness of information provided. The identity of informers will be kept private if they so request,” he said in a statement yesterday. 
The family is pleading with the public for help as police investigations have not come up with any significant leads as to the identity of Koh’s abductors or their accomplices. 
Investigators had so far failed to trace the three heavily-tinted SUVs used in the abduction or the location of the Honda Accord driven by Koh when he was kidnapped. 
Those with any credible information or leads on the investigation can contact Jonathan at 011-3973 2670. 
Liew said while the family was gratified by the outflow of prayers and good wishes from concerned people, they hope the public will respect the need to keep Jonathan’s phone number free for investigation purposes only. 
Koh was abducted last Monday by a group of masked men on Jalan SS4B/10, Petaling Jaya, less than 100m from the police housing complex. 
He was driving a silver Honda Accord bearing the licence plate number ST 5515 D. 
His abduction was confirmed by Selangor CID chief Senior Asst Comm Fadzil Ahmat the day after the alleged crime. 
Police said they were still investigating Koh’s disappearance.
